description:
In my attempt to fix https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/882889 in the docs, I introduced a new doc bug in the developer guide: now parts of the module names listed in the API reference on http://nova.openstack.org/devref/index.html are missing dots.

For example:

novaapi.auth should be nova.api.auth
novaapi.direct should be nova.api.direct
title: In RST docs, some module names now missing a dot

comments.content:
In my attempt to fix https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/882889 in the docs, I introduced a new doc bug in the developer guide: now parts of the module names listed in the API reference on http://nova.openstack.org/devref/index.html are missing dots.

For example:

novaapi.auth should be nova.api.auth
novaapi.direct should be nova.api.direct
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lorinh

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/3594

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/3594
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/d8b6b65f3234c276c15f284e191aba8caceb0cc7
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit d8b6b65f3234c276c15f284e191aba8caceb0cc7
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jan 31 16:16:24 2012 -0500

    Fix broken devref docs.
    
    Fix bug 888102.
    
    This patch fixes the documentation generated here:
    	http://nova.openstack.org/devref/index.html
    
    There was a typo in a script that resulted in the module names being
    invalid and no docs being generated.  This one character patch fixes it
    up and makes the docs happy.
    
    Change-Id: I1986e8b468334a1a33264aaec740c4f535a7c30b
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
